metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14040 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An invalid write access was discovered in bin/jp2/convert.c in OpenJPEG2.2.0, triggering a crash in the tgatoimage function. The vulnerability maylead to remote denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14040` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
